programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May are challenged to create a TV advert for Volkswagen, but soon fall out as James concentrates on detailed information on fuel economy and Jeremy wants something more exciting. Richard Hammond explores an alternative to Germanic sports saloons and tests the Vauxhall VXR8 Bathurst, and former US chat show host Jay Leno is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier champions two teams of car lovers on their mission to design and build scrap vehicles capable of beating pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar in a daring challenge. This time, they take on the iconic Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a handling head to head. Their mechanical ingenuity and driving skills are put to the ultimate test as they race against both the supercar and the clock.

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy has her god-daughter dumped on her overnight, which wouldn't be so bad except the girl's stay coincides with her birthday - leaving the inexperienced guardian and her flatmate Lee struggling to come up with appropriate entertainment for a bunch of excited nine-year-olds. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with a guest appearance by Paul Kaye (Game of Thrones).

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee manages to persuade Lucy to spend a long weekend on his dad's new boat, despite her inability to swim and lifelong fear of water. However, the vessel turns out to be not quite the sleek yacht they were expecting. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Bobby Ball and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee wants to create the perfect Christmas for Lucy, so he invites her to spend the holiday in a cosy old country house that used to belong to his dear, dead old aunt - and to make it a proper family get-together, he invites along her parents and dipsy friend Daisy. But the Christmas spirit is in short supply when Lucy discovers that the cottage has not been lived in for years - and it isn't long before they have sensed a spooky presence. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix star in this festive special of the sitcom, with Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant. Festive edition from 2013.

Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.

James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Royal Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: The Earl of Erroll - Death in the Valley
programme.desc: Crimes involving members of royal families from around the globe, beginning with an earl shot dead in a hedonistic hideaway for colonial aristocrats in Kenya.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How some of our greatest railways have challenged engineering's finest minds in their efforts to conquer the planet's waterways, including a tunnel beneath the English Channel..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: Attenborough's Living Lights
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of bioluminescence, the often spectacular natural light produced by creatures including glow-worms, fireflies and plankton, using specially designed cameras, some fitted to a new generation of deep-sea submersibles and robots to record instances in the very deep ocean. The programme shows a millipede glowing on the forest floor in California, the mesmerising flashing light patterns of the synchronous firefly, the spooky glow of a rare dragon fish and luminous earth worms in France.

programme.title: The World at War

The state visit of former President of France Jacques Chirac sees the staff organise a banquet and a performance of a West End musical inside the building - but protesters outside threaten to mar proceedings.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. programme.title: The Russian Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary charting the events following Lenin's rise to power, as the anticipated communist society was superseded by totalitarianism. After an attempt on his life, Lenin instituted a severe crackdown on political opponents and the bourgeoisie that inspired opposition from a number of factions and led to the assassination of the royal family.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dover to the Isle of Wight. Geographer Nicholas Crane hangs off the cliffs near Beachy Head, East Sussex, to discover how the chalk coastline was formed and historian Neil Oliver investigates why the Victorian Channel Tunnel was started more than 120 years ago but never finished. Meanwhile, anthropologist Alice Roberts visits the Isle of Wight, where she meets the men who helped launch Britain's first satellite.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Real Ark of the Covenant
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston goes in search of the location of the real Ark of the Covenant, believed to be held in a chapel in Ethiopia that is now in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: Porridge

Sean tells Jess he wants to be with her after guessing she is pregnant, and cancer patient Maggie is told the devastating news she has only weeks to live.

programme.desc: A child is airlifted to Holby after almost drowning, Baz is traumatised when she has to take a blood sample from her own baby, while a suspected meninigitis case causes concern.

programme.desc: Jim investigates links between a sinister coven and a man apparently frightened to death by his dreams. Charles Gray guest stars, with Jill Meager, John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread

programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but tries to pretend everything is fine when her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen pay a visit. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg's decision to write his memoirs causes Howard a great deal of concern, while Smiler is devastated when a blossoming relationship ends suddenly. Long-running comedy series, starring Peter Sallis, Robert Fyfe and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: Bacchus and Gently are called in to investigate the death of a miner, which is being treated as suspicious because even though his body was discovered down the pit, records show he was above ground when he disappeared. Alleged victim Arthur Hawkes was a proud union man, and his children confirm he fought long and hard to keep the closure-threatened mine open. But as the detectives dig deeper, they find that not everyone agrees with this portrait of him. Could he really have sold his union comrades down the river? Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with Simon Greenall, Jack Deam and Michael Socha.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: With Sasha back on fighting form, UCOS investigates the death of a talented cricket prodigy, who was the apple of his father's eye, yet loathed by his on-field team-mates. The death was recorded as misadventure but with new evidence pointing to infighting, over-zealous autograph hunters and extra marital affairs, UCOS are soon bowled over by the list of potential murder suspects. Meanwhile, wise to Steve's monetary problems, Danny appoints himself as his personal financial adviser. Detective drama, starring Larry Lamb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Jim investigates the murders of a Glasgow by-election candidate and her agent, who had been championing the return of capital punishment. However, the veteran detective finds himself hard-pressed to arrive at a quick solution to the crime. Elsewhere, a young woman is strangled by her stalker then raped. Robert Carlyle makes one of his earliest screen appearances, alongside star Mark McManusrs.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Two mysterious murders appear to be the work of an ancient Mayan curse attached to a statue acquired by Lovejoy. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.desc: General Wellesley receives unwanted reinforcements from the King of Spain in the form of the Royal Irish Company and Sharpe is charged with transforming them into an effective fighting unit. When Kiely learns his wife is pregnant, he sends her away out of harm's way, but she is captured. With Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Hugh Fraser.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Oz finds himself back in England after a night of heavy drinking - but has no idea how he got there. Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A spate of petty pilfering in the hut leads to fears that one of the lads may be a thief - and prompts Oz to come up with a novel way of catching the culprit. Classic comedy, starring Kevin Whately, Jimmy Nail and Timothy Spall.

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Long Black Coat
programme.desc: Victor's continuing campaign against bureaucrats finds another victim - a health and safety inspector who comes to check on the compost heap at the bottom of the Meldrews' allotment. Christmas special from 1991, with guest star Eric Idle.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: As the Brokenwood Golf Club gathers for its Wednesday morning round, a zombie-like figure lurches from the morning mist identified as Alison Stone, the wealthy club owner. Her face red and blistering, she collapses into a bunker and dies leaving Mike and Kristin to investigate an apparent homicide by poisoning. Detective drama, starring Neill Rea, Fern Sutherland, Pana Hema Taylor and Nic Sampson.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: The Murdochs' housewarming party is cut short when a man is cooked to the point of exploding in a closet-sized microwave prototype. Return of the crime drama, starring Yannick Bisson.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: When a magician's assistant is killed, Frankie goes undercover to find the culprit. But can she see clearly through the smoke and mirrors?.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister reluctantly agrees to act on behalf of a recently released jailbird accused of kidnapping his infant son, and gets caught up in a bitter tug-of-love battle. Returning home in search of solace, he clashes with daughter Kate over her growing independence - and finds himself forced to accept she is now a woman. John Thaw stars in the legal drama, with guest appearances by Dougray Scott and Toyah Willcox.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Tough former Met officer PC Roger Valentine joins the team and immediately makes a good impression by cracking down on muggings in the Sun Hill area - but his old-fashioned attitude toward homosexuality threatens to ruffle a few feathers when he's partnered with Lance. Jim continues to struggle with his gambling addiction and chilling CCTV footage of Abi makes Samantha fear for her daughter's safety.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry's father visits Sun Hill to collect his murdered daughter's belongings, reopening old wounds for Smithy who begins to see Gabriel for the manipulative psychopath he is and threatens to officially accuse him of rape. Elsewhere, Gary thinks he's stumbled across a dismembered body - until Suzie points out the grisly remains are actually a collection of prosthetic limbs.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The offer of a substantial reward inspires Hetty to find the bright spark behind a spate of arson attacks, and she begins by investigating the activities of a neighbour's foster daughter whose absences from home coincide with the fires. Housewife-detective series, starring Patricia Routledge, with Derek Benfield and Dominic Monaghan.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The detectives find themselves swamped with work after their recent success. Hetty turns her attention to a troubled village, while Robert and Geoffrey embark on a case of their own. Private eye drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Cinder Path
programme.desc: Feature-length drama about one man's journey through love and war in the early part of the 20th century. Charlie MacFell returns from university to the family farm, where his strict father still rules with an iron fist - a situation that soon changes thanks to a misunderstanding with a foolish farmhand. Lloyd Owen stars, with Catherine Zeta-Jones, Tom Bell and Maria Mile.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives are busy preparing for Sister Evangelina's surprise jubilee celebrations, marking 50 years since she took her vows, but a face from the past threatens to ruin the party for the guest of honour. It's back to business when a young woman with Down's syndrome is brought in feeling unwell. To everyone's surprise, they discover she is six months pregnant, causing some of them to think the worst, and the staff are joined by new nurse Patsy, whose sense of humour and no-nonsense attitude make her an instant hit.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie is chuffed when local curate Tom invites her to join him for a day of cricket, sending her to work with a spring in her step. Is love on the cards for the young midwife? Shelagh's infertility has made her think long and hard about what she wants in life, so she approaches her husband with an idea, while Patsy upsets a young mother in the clinic and is moved to the district rota, where she works tirelessly to diagnose a docker's unusual symptoms.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry and the team agree to help a man who believes his wife is still alive, even though she apparently died 18 months earlier in a car accident. They decide the best way to convince him is to have her exhumed - only to be faced with more questions than answers when it turns out the body is not hers after all. Meanwhile, Brian needs to find a handyman when Esther bans him from his latest DIY project. Hugh Dennis and Samuel West guest star, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: American diplomat Ryan Reed is shot dead and the team arrives at the scene to find his body posed - sitting upright on a bench with his hand tucked inside his jacket. An argument quickly ensues between the police and the US embassy, which claims the murder falls under its jurisdiction, while the Lyell crew fights against the bureaucracy of the FBI, aided only by the US deputy chief of mission Matt Garcia. However, when he goes missing, Nikki is concerned he might be the next target.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. The body of a Falklands War veteran who became one of the leading lights in the campaign against nuclear weapons is found in a stretch of river running underneath the Ministry of Defence. As Boyd and the team set about investigating the man's former allies, they stumble upon footage of an incident intelligence services had tried to cover up - and Grace is reunited with a former lover from her own time in the anti-nuclear movement. Drama, starring Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston, with Jack Shepherd (Wycliffe, Into the Storm), John McArdle (Brookside) and Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral, Spooks).

programme.desc: Anna Westin, a troubled childhood friend of Wallander's daughter, visits his house late at night begging for his help - but disappears soon afterwards. Meanwhile, an elderly woman's burned body is found in a shallow grave, and when the detective discovers a connection between Anna and the murder victim, he fears she could be the next target of a dangerous religious fanatic. Linda returns to Ystad to help with the investigation, and has life-changing news for her father. Guest starring Lindsay Duncan (Rome), with Kenneth Branagh and Jeany Spark.

Smithy plays a dangerous double game, trying to worm his way into Gabriel's confidence, while simultaneously urging Andrea to spill the beans about the psychotic copper's rape of Kerry - but the undercover reporter soon has other things on her mind when Phil catches her in a passionate embrace with Neil.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Medical drama series charting life on the wards of Holby City Hospital. The casts of Casualty and Holby City unite for this action-packed special which sees the emergency and surgical staff thrown together when a fuel tanker crashes into the hospital.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pair of twins are both taken ill, and when one dies the other seems set to respond in kind. Baby Louis is almost smothered by his nanny, who exhibits signs of Munchausen's syndrome. Charlie accidentally brushes against a woman, who makes an official complaint accusing him of sexual harassment.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tempers are running high at the Taveriers, while Rachel awaits important news about her future.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle, Clyde and Pat believe their jobs at the Queen Vic are under threat, but Sharon is preoccupied wth more personal matters and keeps Grant guessing.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The fire-fighting drama returns. Blue Watch deals with a fire at a hotel which is run as council accommodation. Bayleaf is set up on a date with Clare.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer attempts to sell dodgy prints to a friend of Lady Jane Felsham - only to learn Eric has procured a bronze statue in a house on a pig farm famously stolen from Her Majesty the Queen. Drama, starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim hunts for sunken treasure that has attracted too much attention from the wrong people while tracking down a crooked property tycoon, and discovers the key to it all lies in an eccentric old woman's past. Beryl Reid guest stars, with John Nettles and Sean Arnold.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: A exploitative photographer suggests Aveline should pose topless - but soon regrets his suggestion. Meanwhile, Jack makes an inauspicious entry into the art world.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: A golf pro teaches Captain Peacock how to swing a club - but in the process strikes a blow on Mrs Slocombe's head that causes her to revert to childhood. Comedy, starring Frank Thornton and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel moves in with Jean, but each has trouble letting go of their independence. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Mouse in the Poetry Group?
programme.desc: Smiler begins attending a poetry group and is inspired to write verses for an enchanted Marina. When the two go to the meeting together, an anxious Howard needs to find a way of keeping an eye on them without being seen - and Truly claims to have the perfect solution.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are called in to investigate the death of a musically gifted schoolboy whose drugged and drowned body has been found in a canal. For Dalziel, the case forces painful memories to resurface, while Pascoe exposes hidden scandals at the victim's school. Crime drama, starring Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan, with Sarah Smart and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Sasha is occupied with a training course, the boys' investigations take them to a lookalike agency, where their top two acts were found dead in an apparent double suicide 13 years ago. In an industry reliant on the art of the illusion and their suspects intent on giving them the run around, Ted, Steve and Danny are convinced there's more to this case than first meets the eye. Steve is thrilled when their enquiries take them to the door of one of his football heroes, but his glee is short-lived. Detective drama, starring Denis Lawson.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The detectives connect the killing of a gypsy woman near Glasgow to a policeman stabbed in London during a jewel robbery, but their inquiries are hampered by a team from the Met.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Bob Hoskins stars in the first of a lavish two-part adventure based on Arthur Conan Doyle's novel about a British scientific team's 1911 expedition into the uncharted Amazon jungle in search of prehistoric life. Maverick Professor Challenger leads the quest for a mythical plateau, aiming to prove his theory that dinosaurs still roam certain parts of the Earth.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor unwittingly saves the life of a brutal East End villain, who begins terrorising patients and staff alike. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Steve Evans meets a mystery woman and soon realises that she is more closely linked to the army than he would like. Mark finds himself breaking the law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Rob probes the circumstances of Jimmy Cross's shooting and learns the truth about his father's murder, sending him on a mission of vengeance that culminates in a tense stand-off. Elsewhere, Abi's kidnapper sends Samantha a macabre message that leads her to an equally sinister website, and Phil taunts Neil over his affair with Andrea.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is sedated in maternity and wakes up to find she cannot remember the tragic events of the previous week. Will's attitude problem causes trouble in the canteen, leading to another run-in with Connie. Jess tells Sean she is not ready to break the news about the baby to her father - but that's the least of her worries after she goes for a scan.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie's colleagues demonstrate their support for him in the sexual harassment case being brought by Mrs O'Donnell, while a local journalist claims to have injured his wrist in a bid to get to the heart of the story.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Celestine tries to reassure Etta about Lloyd, and Sharon is upset about Grant making plans for the future without consulting her.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ethel is forced to make a difficult decision, one that has serious consequences for a very close friend.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A new station commander arrives and causes friction in the team as he implements a stricter regime. Meanwhile, a fire is started at a local primary school.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.sub-title: Who Is the Fairest of Them All?
programme.desc: The antiques dealer is asked to sell a sinister-looking mirror from a ballet school, and determines to finally marry Lady Jane. However, the object of his affections has some shocking news for him that suggests he may have left matters too late. Roger Lloyd Pack (Trigger in Only Fools and Horses) guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Ice maiden Philippa Vale shows up in Jersey just as a large diamond is about to be auctioned - and sure enough, it soon disappears. Liza Goddard guests alongside John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie's sea-faring brother dies, so the Boswells decide it would be fitting to arrange a burial at sea. Carla Lane's comedy, starring Jean Boht and Ronald Forfar.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The store advertises on Citizen Band radio, but unfortunately Mrs Slocombe's attempt to publicise her underwear attracts the attentions of the wrong type of customer. Shop-floor comedy, with Mollie Sugden and featuring the voice of Robbie Coltrane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean opens another secretarial agency, but needs someone to run it. Work for Lionel seems to have dried up, giving her cause for concern. Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg comes off his bike after cycling downhill and sustains a fractured foot. Truly believes that the accident would never have happened if the vehicle had been fitted with studded tyres - and immediately sets about organising a practical demonstration of his theory.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: The maverick High Court Judge's daughter is arrested during a demonstration, presenting him with the challenge of getting her off the hook without falling foul of powerful enemies he has made in his single-minded push to the top of the legal profession. Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden and Caroline Langrishe star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: UCOS looks into the murder of a private investigator who was stabbed through the heart in a suspected robbery gone wrong. The answers may lie with the victim's last three cases, but it'll take the whole team's expertise to crack the codes within his mysterious notebook. The movements of a rare stamp could hold the key to the investigation - if only UCOS could track it down. Meanwhile, Steve has problems when he rents out his flat.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Jardine and Taggart investigate the murder of a pensioner, focusing their inquiries on his daughter and son-in-law. Unfortunately, the case soon takes an unexpected turn. Glasgow-set detective drama, starring Mark McManus and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Lost World
programme.desc: Trapped on the plateau, Edward, Agnes and Lord Roxton set out in search of professors Challenger and Summerlee, following their capture by the strange apemen who may provide the missing link between modern man and prehistoric life. But when they mount a rescue, the explorers are confronted by a native tribe. Conclusion of the adventure, starring Bob Hoskins, Peter Falk and James Fox.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Mark and Cate's new baby falls ill, which prompts a revelation from Cate. Meanwhile, Butcher and Stacey grow closer when he rescues a soldier.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The hunt for Abi Nixon's kidnapper takes on renewed urgency when it appears she is being held captive in a sealed container with only a couple of hours' oxygen left. Psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis reckons the taunting messages sent by the culprit point to an old adversary with a grudge, and soon pinpoints a likely suspect, while Phil offers the distraught Sam solace in her darkest hour.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie suffers complications with her pregnancy and has to undergo an emergency Caesarean, but the outcome has heartbreaking repercussions for all concerned. Jess tries to get out of her quandary by telling Sean she is going to have an abortion, though he begs her not to go through with it. Connie suspends Will after he unwittingly talks to a journalist about the canteen strike he caused.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A man fractures his right leg in two places and cracks a rib after the walls of a well fall onto him. Tragedy strikes after Josh is asked to attend a fire at his own home, while Matt hands in his resignation and makes plans to move to Crete.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian entertains an important business client, while Pat sets Frank a daunting task.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot fears the launderette has been broken into, Ian is looking troubled, Clyde and Hattie are sure that Lloyd is up to no good, while Frank makes Dot an offer she cannot refuse.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: A dramatic warehouse fire in London requires every fire squad in the area to deal, leaving the rest of the city vulnerable to unfortunate mishaps. The Blue Watch team is called in to deal with such an emergency when a nuclear fuel train comes to a stop, and Tate makes a frightening discovery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Left to look after Felsham Hall until it has been sold, Lovejoy uses the house as a furniture showroom. It seems unlikely anyone could replace Lady Jane in the dodgy dealer's affections - but that doesn't prevent his eye being caught by glamorous auctioneer Charlotte Cavendish. Charlie Gimbert eventually buys the property, and agrees to rent the stables for Lovejoy Antiques. Patricia Hayes guest stars in an episode directed by Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A pair of rich fashion designers are too preoccupied to realise their child's nanny is not all she seems. When their worst nightmare comes true and their baby is abducted, it is up to Jim to track them down. John Nettles stars, with Sheila Ruskin and Duncan Preston.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline bares all for the front cover of a magazine, Adrian finds himself out of a job and a card game leaves Freddie Â£500 in debt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The gang visits 10 Downing Street to campaign against a Japanese takeover - and Mrs Slocombe gets a chance to demonstrate that Britain has women even more formidable than Mrs Thatcher. Comedy, starring Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean searches for a manager to run the agency, while Lionel gets to work on the outline for an American mini-series based on their real-life romance. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler reminisces about a woman who escaped his advances during the war without leaving her contact details, so Truly, Alvin and Billy volunteer to track her down - even though it means a foray into hostile territory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy, Keith Clifford and Stephen Lewis.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: A concerned mother hires Hetty to find out who is stalking her daughter just days before her wedding. It's not long before the unlikely sleuth is on the trail of a disgraced soldier with a grudge against the father of the bride-to-be. Light-hearted drama, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Spin-off from Miss Fisher's Murder Mysteries, set in the 1960s, following Miss Fisher's niece, who sets out to investigate what happened to her aunt. In the first of a two-part story, Peregrine Fisher arrives in Melbourne to collect her inheritance from her aunt, Phryne Fisher. Wanting to be part of the same Adventuresses' Club as her aunt, Peregrine decides to follow in Phryne's footsteps and solve the murder of a dead model at a bridal fashion show. Geraldine Hakewill stars.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A skeleton uncovered in the foundations of a swimming pool is identified as a young lottery winner named Cheryl, who was reported missing 17 years ago. The prime suspects are her fellow quiz team-mates, who won their lucky windfall as part of a syndicate, and while some have put their money to good use, the victim's boyfriend has fallen on hard times and the media remain convinced he is the key to her murder. As allegations of affairs, fights and betrayal begin to surface, the team is left to ponder whether money really is the root of all evil.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A body is discovered in the boot of a vehicle that has just been through the car crusher, presenting Taggart and Jardine with a case that seems to connect the worlds of drug dealers and artists. Mark McManus and James Macpherson star.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B company are called in to help during a fire brigade's strike. Andy Butcher finally plucks up the courage to ask Stacey out.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia has a very emotional day comforting her friend Maggie Thornton in her final hours, and Mickie tries to console Mubbs, who is in a foul mood over Rosie and the baby. Will refuses to apologise to the canteen staff and has to endure taunts about his aristocratic background. As Jess is about to tell Sean and Ric the truth about her pregnancy, she is interrupted by Connie introducing the new head of anaesthetics - who happens to be a familiar face.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh confides in Baz over the devastation of losing his family, while Matt tells Jude he is going to Crete in part because of the upset over the abortion. The battle between two warring families spills into the hospital wards.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There are difficult decisions to be made for the Taverniers, and the Fowlers get some bad news.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Life and death decisions cause discord at the Fowlers'.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Two building workers are buried under collapsed scaffolding at the edge of a river, and Josie is one of the first women to attend the junior officers' training course.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is assigned to protect a demanding tennis player who has received several death threats. The amiable cop tries to keep his personal feelings in check in the course of his professional duties. John Nettles and Reece Dinsdale star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack's van is held up at gunpoint and Adrian announces he has found a girlfriend. Meanwhile, Billy becomes increasingly frustrated over Julie's attitude to their relationship.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's beloved cat goes missing, so she turns to Mr Humphries for support in her hour of need. Fearing the feline may never return, the staff buy her a kitten. John Inman and Mollie Sugden star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel travel to Los Angeles to discuss turning their story into a film, but the brash executive deciding their fate doesn't allay their fears. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The murder of famous cricketer Kenneth Waring presents Lynley with a fresh challenge to his deductive powers _ and as the case unfolds, he is forced to break the rules in a desperate bid to lure the killer into the open. Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Lesley Vickerage star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they don't put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Craggy cop Jim Taggart investigates the murder of an undertaker found in a burnt-out car, and soon realises that all the evidence points to local French teacher Francoise Campbell, whose pupils seem strangely anxious to protect her. Whodunit, starring Mark McManus, James MacPherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack arrives home drunk, Aveline puts her desire for a baby on hold, and Nellie meets her admirer in the park.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: High Streets: End of the Road? Tonight
programme.desc: A report on the downward trend in spending in Britain's high-street stores over the past 10 years. Geraint Vincent follows typical shopping street Dalton Road in Barrow-in-Furness through the crucial festive period and hears from firms facing high rates and tough competition from the internet and retail parks. But to some, high streets are more than just a place of business - they are a crucial part of the community. Geraint also meets those trying to attract more visitors, and explores whether everyone has a responsibility to support town centres.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: David's thrilled when Shona regains consciousness and tries to speak, until it becomes clear she doesn't recognise him. Paul's horrified when Sean reveals Bernie's plan, and Geoff suggests Yasmeen should steer clear of Speed Daal for a while as she might be tempted to have a drink.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the lush Ionian island of Corfu, beginning in its capital, Corfu Town, where she discovers a surprising, cosmopolitan city more like a little slice of Italy than Greece. After sampling the delights of its famous mumquat flavoured ice-cream, a cookery lesson in making signature savoury dish pastitsada reveals the island's centuries-old love affair with exotic spices. Julia meets a pair of brothers passionate about revolutionising production of Corfu's oldest and most important export - olive oil- and ends her stay trying out the secret to staying young that all Corfiots swear by.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Realising he's been set up by Bernie, Kel makes a grab for her phone. Jade confronts Fiz in the street, and tells her she never intended for her to lose her kids, but she's only got herself to blame. Over their game of chess, Roy puts pressure on Nina to move in.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: The Brits Are Coming
programme.desc: Alice Levine announces the 2020 Brit Award nominees. With performances by some of 2019's biggest acts, including Liam Payne, Mabel, Aitch, Freya Ridings and Dermot Kennedy.

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: Adam finds himself in hot water at work, while his relationship with Karen continues to affect the group. Jenny has finished her cancer treatment, but her struggle is far from over, while David begins to see Mary in a new light. The return of Mike Bullen's comedy drama, starring James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by singer Louise Redknapp and chefs Jonathan Phang and Graham Garrett. Wine expert Ewen Lacey answers viewers' questions.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Vegetarian food ideas, presented by Henry Firth and Ian Theasby. First on the menu are Sunday roast, vegan cheese in a toasted sandwich, sticky toffee pudding and snack ideas using avocados. The hosts are joined by actress Sadie Frost, who tries their jalfrezi curry.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman. Another six famous faces make their debut on the ice in the hope of avoiding the skate-off at the end of the show against last week's lowest-scoring performer. There is also a routine by the cast of new musical The Prince of Egypt. The full line-up of celebrities are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Ian 'H' Watkins, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely, Trisha Goddard and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle looks for blue sharks off the Isles of Scilly and Cornwall, while Liz Bonnin is in Dorset to sample local gin and find out why it is a true taste of the countryside. Plus, there's a return to Ravenseat Farm in the Yorkshire Dales, where shepherdess Amanda Owen and her brood of nine children head off to auction to sell their lambs.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on a large arcade-style 'coin-pusher' machine. The more counters they collect, the greater the prize fund, with the last one standing competing for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Quiz show hosted by Bradley Walsh. Pete, Sheila, Maisie and Noel must pit their wits against the Chaser, a ruthless quiz genius determined to stop them winning the cash prize..

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Sean Fletcher and Ryan Thomas to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win Â£50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. Regular panellists Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong try to identify the mysterious celebrities disguised as a daisy, a fox, an octopus, a tree and a monster.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes Amanda Holden on a booze cruise to Calais and goes guitar shopping with rock band Busted, chatting about their lives and careers along the way.

programme.title: Horrible Bosses (2011)
programme.desc: A power-crazed bully, a sleazy cocaine addict and a sexual predator each make an employee's life a misery, but the three workers cannot afford to quit their jobs. They resort to desperate measures by conspiring to murder each other's bosses, with a little help from an eccentric ex-convict. Comedy, starring Jason Bateman, Charlie Day, Jason Sudeikis, Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Aniston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: Animal lover, comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong opens the doors of his multispecies pet training school, greeting Kevin the chow chow dog and Rambo the miniature New Zealand kunekune pig, to see if they can be taught to beg, spin and roll over. This week's star pet is Pudsey, the first dog to win Britain's Got Talent and which died recently. Plus, the show's trainers hit the road to see if they can train two chickens to play the world's most unusual game of Celebrity Guess Who by attempting to pick out the faces of Ant McPartlin and Katie Price from a constellation of stars.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott continues his tour of Jamaica, taking a trip into the Blue Mountains to learn the secrets of the region's famous coffee. He also visits one of the island's most acclaimed jerk chicken establishments and tries to get his hands on their secret recipe, before whipping up a mango and pineapple milkshake at famous hotel Jamaica Inn.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up a plant-based lasagne, a vegan breakfast - including smoky barbecue beans, vegan scrambled eggs and a meat-free alternative to bacon - and salted caramel apple crumble with custard. The duo also try to convince meat-loving weatherman Alex Beresford that their big bosh burger is as good as the meaty ones he loves, and for their snack hacks, they show off their recipes for nut butters.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the final leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo takes a railway adventure to picturesque Lake Iseo, a hidden gem often overshadowed by its big sisters Garda and Como. He starts out angling for sardines, then takes his catch and prepares a dish of grilled fish for the passengers of Treno dei Sapore - a tourist train that takes guests along the lakeside and into the Franciacorta region. While they enjoy the views they also get a seven-course meal - with today's starter cooked by Gino.

They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following Trisha Goddard's elimination last week, the remaining 11 celebrities and their professional partners perform routines from famous musicals. They will be hoping to get a high score from judges Jayne Torvill, Christopher Dean, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman - not to mention plenty of viewer votes - and avoid having to compete in the skate-off. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of 19-year-old apprentice electrician Dennis Bayliss is discovered washed up on the shore of a North Northumberland rural estate. The victim turns out to be the estranged son of Steph and Rob Bayliss who are left crippled by his death, having lost him once already when he abandoned them to seek out his biological father, Thomas Walken, who just happens to run a salmon farm on the spot where the body was found. Vera is forced to look closer at the strained relationships of Dennis's two families in order to find the truth about his death.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, the actor and his son head to the Great Smoky Mountains on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, where they go canoeing on the iconic rapids that featured in the film Deliverance. With Bradley left in need of a whisky, they head to a Hillbilly Jam for a nightcap and to experience the mountain tradition of clog dancing, before the pair try their hand at chopping wood with some competitive lumberjacks and taking to the woods to search for a mythical mountain beast.

programme.title: The Metro: A Rail Life Story
programme.desc: Documentary following workers on the Tyne and Wear Metro - the UK's largest metro system outside of London. In the first edition, staff in Sunderland prepare for the arrival of 50,000 Spice Girls fans ahead of the pop group's concert at the Stadium of Light. The pressure rises across the day as head of operations Wayne spots a potential fault with an overhead line, and there's an anxious call to the control room - a set of fans have lost their tickets for the concert of a lifetime. Narrated by Zoe Hakin.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Laura's online attack on Andrew yields unexpected consequences as a figure from her past returns to haunt her, potentially jeopardising the case. Laura resorts to extreme measures to find hard evidence of Andrew's guilt.

programme.desc: I'd Do Anything and West End star Jodie Prenger does the honours in the kitchen as Team Glam sets out to guess the identity of their next celebrity host.

Elsewhere, David embraces his new role, but faces humiliation from a former adversary, while Pete's time on a jury has unexpected consequences for Adam. John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst star in Mike Bullen's long-running comedy drama, with guest appearances by Gemma Jones, Clare Keelan and Sunetra Sarker.

programme.title: Welcome to HMP Belmarsh with Ross Kemp
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ross Kemp's report from inside the maximum-security jail takes him to Belmarsh's jail-within-a-jail, where anti-Islamic inmates have to be separated from Islamic prisoners for fear of violence. He also heads to the prison healthcare unit, and meets transgender prisoner Claire Darbyshire, who was given one of the lowest minimum terms for murder in British legal history after killing her father.

Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

He rounds off his trip by cooking at an award-winning vineyard.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh asks the questions as contestants Andy, Carol, Ellie and Neil pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: During the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Charity and Vanessa have plans, while Ryan makes a decision.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone and Fiz are horrified to discover the back door unlocked and Hope gone. Tim's shocked to find Charlie on his doorstep, and she tells him he can forget about the divorce as she cannot afford the legal fees. Bethany is gutted when Alya reveals that Ray has made her the bistro's new manager.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, Bradley and Barney visit the Red River Gorge in Kentucky, before heading to the supposedly haunted Poasttown Elementary School in Middletown, Ohio. The next day, they travel to Louisville, birthplace of legendary boxer Muhammad Ali, where they follow in his footsteps by sparring at the local boxing gym. At the end of a long day, Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned meal at a KFC restaurant in Kentucky - the home state of the chain's founder Colonel Harland Sanders.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz shows the police the passports and ferry tickets, convinced Jade has abducted Hope. Carla tells an appalled Bethany how Ray made Michelle sign a gagging order, and Charlie returns to No 4 with her bags and explains she's been evicted.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: After a vital discovery at the farm, Stan and Mick feel closer to shoring up their own suspicions about Jeremy. The arrival of Brett, a friend from New Zealand (played by Game of Thrones star Alfie Allen), increases tensions between Jeremy and Julie, while Ann grows ever more alarmed and suspicious of her cousin Jeremy's behaviour, and his handling of the family estate. As preparations for the inquest continue, Stan is concerned that if the bodies are released for cremation, vital evidence will be lost for ever.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: Retirees from Padstow blow a big budget on an oak porch for their renovation, and a property transformation in Liverpool uncovers a slice of history. Elsewhere, the development of a loft conversion for a family living in North London does not go according to plan.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Solihull sort the treasures from their trash. Henry Nicholls tries to get his hands on a military watch and Fay Rutter cannot believe her luck when she is faced with 35 sovereign coins. But how much is she willing to pay? Jan Keyne gets a lesson in profit-making and Simon Schneider gets an offer he can refuse.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Science Alliance answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Craig, Michala, Harry and Frances pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: As more drama unfolds during the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Andrea makes a discovery, and Belle is left confused.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: It is the opening day of Hawksford Outdoor Pursuits, and while Rhona surprises Marlon, he is left determined.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Holidays: Bagging a Bargain Break - Tonight
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents a report on the tourism industry, asking how easy it will be to get a bargain holiday in 2020 in the aftermath of the Thomas Cook collapse.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Major documentary telling the inside story of the royal family and the Queen's record-breaking reign. The first episode focuses on the conflict between love and duty that faces the royals - and which has occasionally threatened to bring down the House of Windsor. Edward VIII fatefully chose love when he abdicated to marry divorcee Wallis Simpson. Charles chose duty when he married Diana. The Queen, however, has managed to find a balance, maintaining a long marriage while becoming the longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: At a time of year when many people feel the pinch in both their wallets and their waistlines, the consumer health show returns, presented by Sian Williams and Ranj Singh. Over the series they compare 12 of the latest diets, beginning with the 16:8 intermittent fasting diet and a meal replacement shake plan. They also find out how it's possible to have a drink ruining blowing a diet, investigating some of the latest low-calorie and low-alcohol tipples on the market.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Comedian Rowland Rivron puts on a dinner party at his home as he plays mystery host to four strangers. Presented by Brian McFadden.
